decks.notes: This Mardu Aggro deck focuses on aggressive plays and efficient creatures to overwhelm the opponent. It utilizes powerful cards like Ob Nixilis, the Adversary and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury to keep the pressure on, while also disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Thoughtseize and Static Prison. The deck also includes a variety of mana-fixing lands and a companion in Jegantha, the Wellspring to ensure a smooth and consistent mana base for a fast and relentless assault on the opponent.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quick and aggressive creature plays, supported by powerful enchantments and burn spells to control the board and deal damage to the opponent. Its key strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and efficient creature presence while disrupting their game plan with spells like Blood Moon and Static Prison. The deck also utilizes a companion card, Jegantha, the Wellspring, to provide additional value and flexibility in deck construction. By combining speed, power, and disruption, this deck aims to outpace and outmaneuver the opponent for a swift victory.

The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to have a fast and aggressive playstyle, utilizing creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Amped Raptor to deal damage quickly to the opponent. The deck also includes removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Bonecrusher Giant to control the board and clear the way for your creatures to attack. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Aether Hub and Blood Moon help to disrupt the opponent's mana base and give you an advantage in the game. By maintaining a relentless offensive strategy, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a swift victory.

This deck focuses on assembling a toolbox of creatures to combo off and win the game. The key strategy is to use cards like Chord of Calling and Urza's Saga to search for specific creatures to help set up your win condition. By running a mix of utility creatures and combo enablers, the deck aims to control the board while setting up its combo pieces for a game-ending play. With access to a variety of creatures and ways to search for them, this deck aims to be flexible and adaptable to various situations in a 1 vs 1 format.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on fast and aggressive gameplay, utilizing low-cost creatures and burn spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent. The inclusion of a companion adds a unique twist to the deck, giving it additional versatility and resources to push for victory. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Blood Moon and Static Prison to control the board and limit the opponent's options. Overall, the strategy revolves around overwhelming the opponent with a combination of creature aggression and direct damage spells to secure a swift victory.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan through counterspells, removal, and hand disruption. The deck aims to control the board with cards like Counterspell, Fatal Push, and Murktide Regent while also disrupting the opponent's hand with Inquisition of Kozilek and Sink into Stupor. The inclusion of cards like Archmage's Charm, Spell Snare, and Force of Negation provides versatility and flexibility in dealing with threats. The deck can efficiently control the game and prevent the opponent from enacting their strategy by consistently disrupting their plays.

This Mardu Aggro deck focuses on aggressive creature-based strategy, using powerful creatures like Amped Raptor and Orcish Bowmasters to deal damage quickly. It also includes cards like Static Prison and Lightning Bolt for disruption and removal. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion allows for additional mana fixing. The deck also features a mix of dual lands and fetch lands for consistent mana base. Overall, the deck aims to establish board presence quickly and overwhelm the opponent with an aggressive game plan.

The main focus of this Mono Black Control deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's resources while gradually building up your own board presence. Through a combination of removal spells, hand disruption, and powerful creatures like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Troll of Khazad-dûm, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and grind them down over time. The deck also utilizes cards like Soul Spike and Fell the Profane to drain the opponent's life total, providing additional win conditions. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's game plan and ensure consistency in casting its spells.

This deck focuses on using creatures with various abilities to create a toolbox of options to find answers and win conditions. It includes cards that allow for tutoring creatures, protecting them, and disrupting the opponent's game plan. The combo potential comes from assembling specific creature combinations for powerful synergies, while also having access to a diverse range of options to adapt to different situations. The lands and spells in the deck support this strategy by providing mana fixing, card draw, and protection for key pieces of the combo.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of countering spells, removing threats, and manipulating the game state to your advantage. The key strategy revolves around utilizing cards like Counterspell, Subtlety, and Force of Negation to disrupt your opponent's plans, while also using cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Tune the Narrative to control the tempo of the game. The win condition is to ultimately establish dominance with powerful cards like The One Ring and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury to overwhelm your opponent and secure victory.

This Mardu Aggro deck focuses on quickly flooding the board with aggressive creatures like Amped Raptor and Ocelot Pride, backed up by efficient removal like Fatal Push and Goblin Bombardment to clear the way for your attackers. The deck also has a subtheme of sacrificing creatures for value with cards like Marionette Apprentice and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah, enabling you to close out the game with a mixture of direct damage and combat damage. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds an extra layer of consistency to the deck's game plan.

The deck's strategy revolves around assembling a toolbox of creatures to combo off with. It focuses on using cards like Chord of Calling and Finale of Devastation to search for key creatures like Nadu, Winged Wisdom and Springheart Nantuko. The deck also includes support cards like Shuko and Summoner's Pact to help facilitate the combo. The mana base includes cards like Windswept Heath and Misty Rainforest to ensure consistent mana production. Overall, the deck aims to create powerful synergies between its creatures to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on countering your opponent's spells while gaining card advantage through various means such as Archmage's Charm, Inquisition of Kozilek, and Preordain. The deck also includes removal spells like Fatal Push and Drown in the Loch to control the board. Murktide Regent serves as a finisher, while cards like Force of Negation and Spell Snare help protect your own game plan. Overall, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while maintaining control of the battlefield and outvalue them in the long game.

The deck focuses on utilizing quick and aggressive creatures to deal damage to the opponent as fast as possible, while also using various spells and abilities to control the board. It aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of efficient creatures like Guide of Souls and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, backed up by removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Goblin Bombardment. The deck also includes cards like Static Prison and Arena of Glory to disrupt the opponent's strategy and create favorable board states. Overall, the deck's strategy is to be fast, aggressive, and disruptive in order to secure a quick victory.

The main idea of this deck is to use cards like Ephemerate, Goryo's Vengeance, and Leyline Binding to quickly reanimate powerful creatures such as Griselbrand and Atraxa, Grand Unifier. The deck also includes disruptive cards like Grief and Thoughtseize to control the opponent's hand while setting up the combo. The use of Misty Rainforest and other fetch lands helps thin the deck and ensure the right cards are drawn. Overall, the strategy focuses on combining fast reanimation with disruptive elements to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory.

This Mardu Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with a mix of aggressive creatures and powerful removal spells. The deck utilizes cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push to disrupt the opponent's strategy while deploying threats like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury to close out the game quickly. The inclusion of goblin Bombardment provides additional reach and allows for additional damage to be dealt even if the opponent manages to stabilize. Overall, the deck aims to apply constant pressure and close out games before the opponent can establish a strong board presence.
